name: Datapress
author: The Haystack Group @ MIT

sections.description:
Datapress is a wordpress plugin that allows you to configure beautiful data presentations for your blog entries using MIT’s Exhibit framework. Without knowing any HTML, you can present your data in timelines, maps, charts, and graphs from within your blog. You can also allow users to dynamically navigate through your datasets, by allowing for search and faceted navigation of the datasets.

Demos and Help

Visit our site at http://projects.csail.mit.edu/datapress/ for more information, videos, and a demo blog.
sections.installation:
1. Download the latest DataPress zip file
  2. Unzip it into your /wp-content/plugins directory
  3. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress

short_description: DataPress lets you publish rich, interactive data visualizations in your blog pages and posts.
